text: This is a list of foreign players in the Indian Super League. The following players: #Are considered foreign, i.e., outside India: ::A player is considered foreign if he is not eligible to play for the national team of India. More specifically, *If a player has been capped on international level, the national team is used; if he has been capped by more than one country, the highest level (or the most recent) team is used. *If a player has not been capped on international level, his country of birth is used. Up to now, 77 different nations have been represented in Indian Super League. ==Current Foreign Players== Indian Super League club could register a maximum of seven and a minimum of five foreign players with at least one player of AFC affiliated nationality. ===Foreign players=== {| class="sortable wikitable" style="text-align: left; font-size:92.5%" |- !scope=col style="width:170px;"| Club !scope=col style="width:170px;"| Player 1 !scope=col style="width:170px;"| Player 2 !scope=col style="width:170px;"| Player 3 !scope=col style="width:170px;"| Player 4 !scope=col style="width:170px;"| Player 5 !scope=col style="width:170px;"| Player 6 !scope=col style="width:170px;"| AFC Player |- !scope=row style="text-align: left;| ATK Mohun Bagan | | | | | | | |- !scope=row style="text-align: left;| Bengaluru | | | | | | Fran González | |- !scope=row style="text-align: left;| Chennaiyin | | | | | | | |- !scope=row style="text-align: left;|SC East Bengal | | | | | | | |- !scope=row style="text-align: left;| Goa | | | | | | | |- !scope=row style="text-align: left;| Hyderabad | | | | | | | |- !scope=row style="text- align: left;| Jamshedpur | | | | | | | |- !scope=row style="text-align: left;| Kerala Blasters | | | | | | Bakary Koné | Jordan Murray |- !scope=row style="text-align: left;| Mumbai City | | | | | | | |- !scope=row style="text- align: left;| NorthEast United | | | | | | | |- !scope=row style="text-align: left;| Odisha | | | | | | | |} ==Top 10 represented country== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !
